intro: Bridelia abyssinica, commonly known as Abyssinian bridelia, is a shrub or small tree native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native region. Bridelia abyssinica is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
